components.name: Fastlane Server
components.description: The central server component that manages tasks, stores configuration, and orchestrates actions across client applications. It handles authentication, authorization, and task scheduling.

components.name: iOS Client
components.description: The iOS client application used by developers to interact with Fastlane, triggering builds, tests, and releases.

components.name: Android Client
components.description: Similar to the iOS client, this application allows Android developers to interact with Fastlane.

components.name: Command-Line Interface (CLI)
components.description: A versatile tool for interacting with Fastlane, offering flexibility for scripting and automation.

data_flows.description: Developers initiate tasks (e.g., build, test, upload) via the client applications or CLI, sending requests to the Fastlane Server.

data_flows.destination: External Services (e.g., Xcode, Gradle, App Store Connect)
data_flows.description: The server triggers actions in external services like Xcode for building, Gradle for Android builds, and App Store Connect for publishing.
External services report build status, test results, and deployment outcomes back to the Fastlane Server.

trust_boundaries.name: Client-Server Boundary
trust_boundaries.description: The boundary between the Fastlane client applications and the Fastlane Server. This boundary controls access to server resources and sensitive data.

trust_boundaries.name: External Service Integration
trust_boundaries.description: The integration with external services like Xcode and App Store Connect.  Trust relies on the security posture of these services.
